$comment: Example Agent — Minimal starter configuration for a2a-wrapper-gh-copilot.
Use this as a copy-paste starting point when building your own agent:
cp -r agents/example agents/my-agent
# Edit agents/my-agent/config.json for your use case
./agents/my-agent/start.sh start
This agent has no external MCP tool servers. For an agent that reads and
writes files via MCP, see agents/filesystem-assistant/.
The agent card is served at GET /agent/card and advertises this agent to
A2A-compatible orchestrators and callers. Fill in a clear name and
description — they are the first thing callers see.
agentCard.name: Example Agent
agentCard.description: A minimal example agent. Replace this description with what your agent actually does.

skills.$comment: Skills are optional but help orchestrators understand agent capabilities without calling it experimentally.
skills.name: General Assistant
skills.description: Answer questions, reason through problems, and assist with general tasks

$comment: Each agent must use a unique port when running multiple agents on the same host.
Change advertiseHost to your machine's IP or domain when running behind Docker or a proxy.
Controls how the wrapper connects to the GitHub Copilot SDK.
model          — The LLM to use. Examples: 'gpt-4o', 'gpt-4.1', 'claude-sonnet-4.5'
systemPromptMode:
'replace'    — Your prompt fully replaces the SDK's default system message.
Use this for a clean, custom persona (recommended for production).
'append'     — Your prompt is appended after the SDK's built-in coding-assistant
message. Use this when you want to layer constraints on top.
copilot.systemPrompt: You are a helpful assistant. Replace this system prompt with instructions that define your agent's role, persona, and expected behaviour.

$comment: streamArtifactChunks: false (default) — buffers artifact chunks and sends them
as a single artifact. More compatible with A2A inspector tools.
Set to true for spec-correct incremental artifact streaming.

timeouts.$comment: prompt — Maximum milliseconds to wait for a single response. Increase for agents that call slow external tools.

logging.$comment: level — One of: 'debug' | 'info' | 'warn' | 'error'. Use 'debug' during development.
